sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Israel buries a second hostage found dead in Gaza, where Palestinians scour the rubble for a few of the thousands who've been killed in airstrikes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's military says its troops have now managed to secure multiple bridgeheads on the eastern bank of the Dnipro River.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The funeral of a 19-year-old Israeli soldier who was held hostage by Hamas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Noah Marciano's body was found near the Al-Shifa hospital that Israel stormed whilst patients were still in it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Israel's aerial bombardment continues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: So far, 11,470 Palestinians have been killed, two-thirds of them women and children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And internet and phone services have collapsed in the Gaza Strip for lack of fuel, the Palestinian provider says.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The UN's World Food Programme has warned of the immediate possibility of starvation as the food supply has broken down since Israel tightened control of Gaza's borders.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Every day, hundreds of people claw through tons of rubble with shovels and iron bars and their bare hands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In Nusayrat refugee camp, people look for survivors after a recent Israeli airstrike.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: On Friday, Israel said it would allow a minimal daily shipment of fuel into Gaza for the UN and the communication system.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Aid agencies say without fuel they can't operate and that people lack enough food and clean water.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And the World Health Organization says disease is spreading rapidly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has met German Chancellor Olaf Scholz in Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Turkey is an essential partner for Germany, which is home to more than three million people with Turkish roots.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But it's an awkward partnership, particularly as Erdogan has described Hamas, who run Gaza, as liberators, whereas Germany views them as a terrorist organization.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And Turkey is also a NATO ally that can stem the flow of refugees and migrants into Europe, an issue which Schulz is under intense pressure domestically to resolve.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The White House has slammed Twitter owner Elon Musk for, quote, abhorrently promoting anti-Semitic and racist hatred. It follows comments the billionaire made on an account holder's post that said Jewish people encourage, quote, hatred against white people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Musk replied, you told the exact truth.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Advertisers are fleeing as social media platform X after tech giant IBM said it had stopped marketing on a site after reports of its ads appearing alongside pro-Nazi content. The European Commission has since suspended its advertising campaigns on the platform due to an alarming rate in disinformation and hate speech.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's military says its troops have now managed to secure multiple bridgeheads on the eastern bank of the Dnipro River.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's a small but potentially significant strategic advance in the midst of a war that's largely at a standstill.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's president tweeted simply, the Kherson region's left bank, our warriors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Russian military has a different version.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It says Ukrainian forces have tried to occupy islands in the river, but lost hundreds of soldiers in the attempt and remain on the western bank. Meanwhile, in Kherson, heavy shelling by the Russians killed three people and injured six on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ukraine is struggling off the battlefield for support from allies as the world's attention has turned to Israel's war against Hamas. Russia will have a record budget for 2024, 36.6 trillion rubles, almost 380 billion euros,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: approved by the Duma on Friday. The budget increases spending by 25 percent, with a record amount going to defense. The development comes as the Kremlin looks to shore up support for President Putin before the March presidential election.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The budget will now go to the Russian parliament's upper chamber for approval before being signed by President Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: French Senator JoÃ«l Garriot was detained by the police on suspicion of drugging an MP

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: with the intention of assaulting her, the Paris Public Prosecutor's Office said.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: MP Sandrine Josseau, who is 48, has accused the 66-year-old of drugging her with ecstasy after she went to his home for dinner.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He's facing charges of administering to a person without their knowledge a substance likely to impair their discernment or control over their actions in order to commit rape or sexual assault.
